intro: Euchresta horsfieldii var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan velvetleaf, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has smooth, glabrous stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
